title: 109_s2695
content: The Federal Research Public Access Act of 2006 aims to make research findings funded by the Federal Government accessible to the public. Congress recognizes the importance of sharing research results to advance science and benefit society. The Act defines a "Federal agency" as an Executive agency under section 105 of title 5, United States Code. The Federal Research Public Access Act of 2006 requires Federal agencies with research expenditures over $100,000,000 to develop a public access policy for research papers. This policy includes submitting final manuscripts of research papers to the agency, incorporating peer review changes, and providing free online access to the published version. The Federal Research Public Access Act of 2006 mandates Federal agencies to maintain functionality and interoperability goals, provide free online access to final peer-reviewed manuscripts within 6 months, create an online bibliography linking to full texts, and ensure long-term preservation and public access to research findings in digital repositories. Each Federal research public access policy mandates immediate availability of works by researchers employed or funded by the agency, marked as public domain material. Exclusions include laboratory notes and preliminary data analyses. The Federal research public access policy mandates immediate availability of works by researchers employed or funded by the agency, excluding laboratory notes, preliminary data analyses, and works that generate revenue or royalties for authors. The Act does not affect any rights under patent or copyright law. Federal agencies must submit a report on their research public access policy annually to specific committees of Congress. The Federal research public access policy requires immediate availability of research papers funded by the agency. Reports must be submitted annually to specific committees of Congress, detailing the effectiveness of the policy, lists of published papers, and the time between journal publication and online availability by the agency. The Federal agency must make research papers and lists of publications available to the public on its website as part of the research public access policy.
